IRS990.MissionDescription: TO OPERATE AFFORDABLE, SUPPORTIVE RESIDENTIAL HOUSING FOR LOW-INCOME SENIORS IN AN ATMOSPHERE THAT SUPPORTS INDIVIDUALITY AND RESPECT, FOSTERS ACTIVE AND ENERGETIC LIFESTYLES, ENCOURAGES INDEPENDENCE AND SELF-FULFILLMENT, AND VALUES VOLUNTEERISM AND PARTICIPATION.
IRS990.Description: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE, AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED PEOPLE THROUGH 128 affordable UNITS AND 86 MARKET RATE UNITS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: the organization collects security deposits from tenants. the deposits are held in a separate bank account and are returned to the tenant at the termination of the lease.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE COMPANY ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACCOUNTING STANDARD ON ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2010. THIS STANDARD CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTIES IN INCOME TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN BY AN ENTITY BEFORE BEING MEASURED AND RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE COMPANY HAS EVALUATED THE APPLICATION OF THE STANDARD AND HAS DETERMINED THAT THE ADOPTION OF THE STANDARD DOES NOT HAVE A MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE COMPANY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE COMPANY IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY U.S. FEDERAL, STATE OR LOCAL TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2007.
accretion of asset retirement obligation: -19201. unrestricted net assets returned to sponsor: -208830.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: steven shulman, a director, has a family relationship with A director of hebrew senior life, inc. (sole member of the organization)

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: HEBREW SENIORLIFE, INC. IN THE SOLE member OF THE ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: hebrew seniorlife, inc. appoints the members of the board of directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DECISIONS INVOLVING MAJOR CHANGES IN ORGANIZATION, BUDGETARY DECISIONS, FINANCING, SALE OF ASSETS, ETC. ARE ALSO SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY HEBREW SENIORLIFE'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: the form 990 is reviewed and approved by the audit committee prior to filing the return. the board of directors are also provided with a copy of the return prior to its filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: the conflicts of interest policy is rigorously monitored by the conflicts review committee of the board of directors of hebrew seniorlife. this involves annually mailing a conflicts disclosure form to all members of the board of directors, board committees and senior management.

THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT DIRECTLY COMPENSATE THE CEO, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES. THEse individuals are compensated by hebrew seniorlife, inc. As such, compensation for the CEO, Executive Directors, Officers, and key employees is determined through Hebrew Seniorlife's compensation process.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, form 990 and financial statements available to the public upon request. In addition, the form 990 is available via guidestar and the Massachusetts attorney general's website.
